newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bonn aims to list Postbank, Post Office.
newsitem.headline: Bonn aims to list Postbank, Post Office.

text.p: Germany aims to privatise Postbank AG either through a private placement or a bourse listing this year and to follow with the listing of the Post Office next, Post and Telecommunications Minister Wolfgang Boetsch said.

In an interview with the Tuesday edition of daily Die Welt newspaper, Boetsch said he would do everything in his power to see that the privatisation of the Postbank, the banking arm of the former Deutsche Bundespost agency, took place this year.
"Let's just leave open whether this happens via cooperation partners or on the stock exchange," he said.
The government expects revenues of some three billion marks from the privatisation, which could involve selling as much as 75 percent of the bank to the public.

He also said the government wanted to privatise postal services group Deutsche Post AG next year because the revenues from the sale would be used to cover pension payments for its employees. Bonn was looking into selling the Post Office "as soon as possible".
